page.title: 14More Holwell Local History
page.content: Parts of hedges on the old routeways appear to be several hundred years old.The routes can still be travelled by road and footpath. There is a smugglers' route from Sandhills towards Barnes Cross,and a secret passage from Sandhills into Holwell Manor. The Kings of England once hunted in the Forest.Some local names such as Crouch Hill, King's Stag and Buckshaw are associated with hunting legends. Modern hunting still takes place. The Blackmore Vale and Sparkford Vale Hunt,often meet in this area. Indeed the thatched Inn that stood for over a hundred years at Crouch Hill was called the "Fox". Sadly it burned down in 1969 and Holwell no longer has a public house.
